I can't help but think of Jesus' words in Matthew 7.15 and following, Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep's clothing, but inwardly are ravenous wolves.  You will recognize them by their fruits.  Are grapes gathered from thorn bushes or figs from thistles?  So every healthy tree bears good fruit, but the diseased tree bears bad fruit.  A healthy tree cannot bear bad fruit, nor can a diseased tree bear good fruit.  Every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.  Thus you will recognize them by their fruits.  Now, beware of false prophets.  Note that they are not the same thing as false teachers.  Peter makes this distinction in his second letter, 2 Peter 2.1.
